Project Overview
----------------

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is inviting contractors to qualify for a project involving the removal and disposal of lead-based paint from structural steel frames at the Mactaquac Biodiversity Facility in New Brunswick.

The project spans two years, with the first year (May 1 to September 30, 2024) focusing on the left wing, and the second year (May 1 to September 30, 2025) focusing on the right wing. Per the project requirements, all hazardous materials must be disposed of according to provincial codes of practice for removal of hazardous materials. The estimated cost for this opportunity falls within the range of $500,001 to $1,000,000.

Scope of Work
-------------

- Removal and disposal of flaking/peeling lead-based paint from structural steel frames in both the left and right wings.
- Repainting of the frames.
- Ensure that all fish tanks are empty during the construction period.

Deliverables and Requirements
-----------------------------

- Completion of lead paint analytical results.
- Estimated quantities of work required.
- Site photos.

The successful contractor will need to adhere to the project specifications and follow all necessary procedures for handling hazardous materials.

Important Details
----------------

- **Location**: Mactaquac Biodiversity Facility, 114 Fish Hatchery Lane, French Village, New Brunswick.
- **Project Timeline**: The project will be completed over two years.
- **Estimated Cost Category**: $500,001 to $1,000,000.

For more information about the project, please visit the provided notice URL or contact the lead point of contact, Timothee Beausoleil.
